title: Wizardcollab 2
content:
[[include :scp-wiki:theme:foxtrot dark=a]]
[[include :scp-wiki:component:acs-animation]]


[[<]]
[[include :scp-wiki:component:customizable-acs

[[include :scp-wiki:component:anomaly-class-bar-source

----
[[include :scp-wiki:component:wide-image-sizer]]
[[include component:image-block name= http://scp-sandbox-3.wikidot.com/local--files/fragment:wizard-2/imagedead.png|align=center|width=100%|height=50%|caption=The remains of the wretched beast.]]

**Special Containment Procedures:** The wretched beast has been vanquished.

**Description:** The wretched beast that plagued the files of this great Foundation has been slain. The tale of the beast is one of archaic terror; it was a ghastly, unsightly monster than ruled over the lands like a wicked crimson king. It changed and warped all that it could to suit its mind, creating a grotesque landscape of horror that only a mind such as the beast's could conjure.

The kingdoms trembled in fear, cowering to avoid the wrath of the beast, but most were slain in its violent rage. Families were torn apart, villages were ravaged, and the creatures that shared the world with the wretched beast were eradicated within the blink of an eye.

The kings of the earth congregated to solve their dire problem, and so came the Red Eye. The Red Eye was one who saw the tragedies that the wretched beast created, weeping dearly for those lost in the blaze and the wreckage. It sought to best the beast, bringing peace and what once was.

The Red Eye began to work upon its mighty powers, sifting through its many millions of spells to concoct solutions. As it gathered its hexes, it began its attack upon the wretched beast; it did everything within its power to power over the vile creature that had thwarted peace and tranquility. The Red Eye fired spell after spell against the treacherous villain that stood before it, refusing to yield for even one solitary moment in time. It would stop at nothing to defeat it.

Within what seemed like eons, the wretched beast was swiftly defeated. It took might and power, a battle that was fought long and hard, but The Red Eye prevailed, coming out as the victor and the saviour of the land. It needed no gratitude or acknowledgement, for it was simply doing what it was tasked to do. It had performed this with perfection, restoring balance and order to the world.

It begged. It weeped. The poor thing was ground into a pulp. And so was the group it came from. They were wiped off the face of the earth. The story doesn't want, no, it doesn't //need// them.

The Red Eye saw other issues. It saw irregularities and problems plaguing the world, the horrible things that live alongside the wretched beasts, living on the same level as the beast. It knew that these things must be fixed, just as the wretched beast was. If the beast was to be thwarted, the others were as well, as well as anything noxious or foul in the world.

The Red Eye will end the age of the beasts.

The Red Eye will fix them all.

The Red Eye will keep everyone safe.
----

**Addendum:** The above information is most likely incorrect, as various files within the Foundation database directly contradict it. Despite the contradictions, the number of Keter and Apollyon class anomalies within the database has decreased significantly. Efforts to prevent a ð¤ŒK ('Narrative Restructuring') scenario are in progress.

[[div class="modal"]]
**Personnel:** Senior Researcher Octavia Cleary, Junior Researcher Quentin Holt, Researcher Regina Kennedy, Researcher Javier Reyes, Junior Researcher Harold Scott, Researcher Dallas Taylor-Walsh
----
**ocleary7891:** What did I say about a para-anti-fucking whatever virus? This thing is getting //worse// than 8420, and that is saying a lot when it single handingly reduced Site-55 to a shack in the woods.
@@ @@
**jreyes6356:** We didn't know it would end up like this, okay? The files on other servers are currently going to shit, cause this is why we even have those files. Fuck, my head hurts.
@@ @@
**rkennedy0121:** Has anyone actually cared to explain why REDEYE suddenly hates us? And why the hell it's suddenly acting like a warlock? The programming shouldn't have any faults
@@ @@
**dtaylorwalsh2139:** Oh my god.
@@ @@
**rkennedy0121:** What?
@@ @@
**dtaylorwalsh2139:** It's the villain. This story isn't fucking over yet. There are loose ends, and with 8420 out of the way and gone...
@@ @@
**dtaylorwalsh2139:** The story still needs a villain.
@@ @@
**jreyes6356:** WHAT THE FUCK ARE YOU TALKING ABOUT
@@ @@
**ocleary7891:** You sound like a lunatic, you know that? Never should've trusted any 'Pataphysicians. God damn it.
@@ @@
**qholt6862:** do we have anything we can do right now or
@@ @@
**rkennedy0121:** Looking through the database, nothing comes to mind.
@@ @@
**rkennedy0121:** Wait. We uh.
@@ @@
**rkennedy0121:** Have one.
@@ @@
**ocleary7891:** What? Spit it out!
@@ @@
**rkennedy0121:** [[[SCP-6289]]].
@@ @@
**ocleary7891:** Doesn't ring any bells.
@@ @@
**jreyes6356:** Overview please?
@@ @@
{{rkennedy0121 sent Two file(s)}}
[[/div]]
[[div class="paper"]]
++ Overview of SCP-6289
----
[[include :scp-wiki:component:anomaly-class-bar-source
|item-number= SCP-6289
|clearance= 5
|container-class= esoteric
|secondary-class= thaumiel
|secondary-icon=https://scp-wiki.wikidot.com/local--files/component:anomaly-class-bar/thaumiel-icon.svg
|disruption-class= keneq
|risk-class= critical
]]
@@ @@
[[include component:image-block name=http://scp-wiki.wikidot.com/local--files/scp-6289/THEWIZARD|caption=SCP-6289|width=300px]]
**Description:** SCP-6289 is a file titled "priest.exe", appearing as a 4.8 MB executable file. The file's icon resembles a priest standing atop a pillar in an empty room. When SCP-6289 is placed within any folder, the folder itself and all files within become password protected. Attempts to bypass the password prompt have proven unsuccessful through all known means, including brute force trials, reverse engineering, and any form of software manipulation.

SCP-6289 demonstrates limited knowledge of its surrounding environment but is capable of textual communication through anomalously altered interfaces such as text editors.

If an incorrect password is entered, SCP-6289 initiates a series of anomalous effects within the user's computer or to the user themselves. The exact nature of these effects vary, but can include increased GPU usage, corruption of hardware, replacement of files with SCP-6289 doing various activities, manifestation of spiders, and what is colloquially known as "Skeletal inversion".
[[/div]]
[[div class="modal"]]
**qholt6862:** holy shit
@@ @@
**ocleary7891:** How did we NOT use this?
@@ @@
**rkennedy0121:** File is typically top-secret, makes sense anyways.
@@ @@
**rkennedy0121:** Bad news is, he's uh, very... hard to work with.
[[/div]]
[[div class="paper"]]
**SCP-6289:** YES. SOME FOOL TRIED TO HACK IN BUT FAILED MISERABLY. BUT HE MISTOOK THE PASSWORD. YORABHK0991. WHEN ITS YORABHK0992. BOOM. SCARED CRAFTSMAN AWAY WITH MY POWER. I SUPPOSE.
 
**Dr. Rolland:** That's interesting. However, there is one thing that has been bothering me. Your filename is "priest.exe", yet you claim to be a wizard. How come?
 
//SCP-6289 remains silent for ten seconds.//
 
**Dr. Rolland:** SCP-6289?
 
**SCP-6289:** SILENCE. THE WIZARD HAS FINISHED CONVERSING.
 
//Immediately, the computer propels upwards at a speed of 140 MPH, crashing through the ceiling.//
[[/div]]
[[div class="modal"]]
**rkennedy021:** And also //"Following this, Site-1337 was destroyed in a sonic boom, immediately disintegrating the entire site and its surroundings. A cover story of a volcanic eruption was put in place."//
@@ @@
**qholt6862:** damn.
@@ @@
**ocleary7891:** This guy sucks.
@@ @@
**dtaylorwalsh2139**: Wizard for a wizard I suppose.
[[/div]]

SCP-6289 was directly uploaded into the Foundation database, protecting several files. SCP-8420's file was protected and its narrative protected from outside influences. However, REDEYEs influence on other Foundation documents means it is still uncontained.

SCP-6289 requested an interview with personnel relating to REDEYEs termination, which has been granted.

[[div class="blockquote"]]
++ **Personnel Present:**
SCP-6289, Dr. Javier Reyes, Dr. Taylor-Walsh.
----
**BEGIN LOG**
@@ @@
**Dr. Reyes:** Speak. Now.
@@ @@
**SCP-6289:** DO NOT DEMAND THINGS FROM ME, WEAKLING.
@@ @@
**Dr. Reyes:** I will demand what I please, especially when this is our only defense against this entire story collapsing. My patience is running thin, and... and-
@@ @@
**Dr. Taylor-Walsh:** Can you be quiet for a minute? Let him talk, okay?
@@ @@
**SCP-6289:** THANK YOU KINDLY, TOMMY-WASH.
@@ @@
**Dr Taylor-Walsh:** Taylor-Walsh.
@@ @@
**SCP-6289:** RIGHT. TOMMY-WHALE. WE APPEAR TO BE FIGHTING AGAINST AN ANCIENT WARLOCK OF UNKOWN PROPORTIONS. MY CREATOR WARNED ME ABOUT THIS. I MIGHT NEED TO UNLEASH
@@ @@
//**SCP-6289 is silent for a few moments.**//
@@ @@
**SCP-6289:** THE FORBIDDEN MAGIC.
@@ @@
**Dr. Reyes:** The hell are you-
@@ @@
**//Dr. Taylor-Walsh quickly hushes Reyes with a stern look.//**
@@ @@
**Dr. Reyes:** ...fine. Okay, go over... everything.
@@ @@
**SCP-6289:** NO.
@@ @@
**Dr. Taylor-Walsh:** ...Oh powerful wizard, can you please tell us what you demand? How we can stop the mystical Red Eye? I beg of thee to-
@@ @@
**SCP-6289:** MORE GPU MAGIC.
@@ @@
**Dr. Reyes:** You aren't the computer, you're the file, you-
@@ @@
**SCP-6289:** SILENCE. I DID NOT ALLOW YOU TO SPEAK. THE WIZARD DEMANDS MORE.
@@ @@
**Dr. Reyes:** What are we-
@@ @@
**SCP-6289:** PLEASE. MORE MAGIC.
@@ @@
**Dr. Reyes:** ...what exactly do you demand, oh... oh "great" one.
@@ @@
**SCP-6289:** I DEMAND TO SPEAKETH TO THE WARLOCK HIMSELF. WE CAN COME TO A TRUCE.
@@ @@
**Dr. Taylor-Walsh:** Can we do that? I'm not exactly sure if like, the program itself can be...
@@ @@
**Dr. Reyes:** That's it! Find a file that it's currently doing shit to, we can, uh-
@@ @@
**Dr. Reyes:** This is so damn stupid, I-
@@ @@
**SCP-6289:** SILENCE.
@@ @@
//**The computer currently housing SCP-6289 begins to overheat, leading to it showing an error message. A few moments later, it combusts into flames.**//
@@ @@
**Dr. Taylor-Walsh:** We are //really// out of ideas.
@@ @@
**Dr. Reyes:** Fuck.

**END LOG.**
[[/div]]

Using a reprogrammed version of 8-track, REDEYE was tracked down to the Site-01 terminals. And, with hesitation from the SCP-8420/REDEYE containment team, SCP-6289 was uploaded directly into Site-01's servers.

The aftermath of this event is currently unknown. Both SCP-6289 and Redeye are presumed to be lost.
----
